text:
I made frozen yogurt last night.
I mean I have frozen yogurt before and it's like OK. But it is like a hard block. Not the soft  ice creamy stuff you get from a froyo shop.
But I got it to work and it is ridiculously simple.
Sugar disrupts the ice formation preventing it becoming a single blocky.
By mass it is like 1 unit of sugar to 4 units of yogurt (I guess less if yogurt is already sweetened).
Beat with electric mixer.
Freeze.

Beat with electric mixer.

text: You can also use salt. Or you could sugar the streets in winter...
